video.title: animate in jQuery - Beau teaches JavaScript
video.description:
The animate() method in jQuery performs a custom animation of a set of CSS properties.

This is a short tutorial on the animate method.

💻 Code: https://codepen.io/beaucarnes/pen/QgXvEG?editors=1010

🐦 Beau Carnes on Twitter: https://twitter.com/carnesbeau

-
Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on technology: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

And subscribe for new programming videos every day: https://youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=freecodecamp

topLevelComment.author: Un Potatoed
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for the video. I started liking jQuery more now!

topLevelComment.author: dedZombie
topLevelComment.text: Hi Beau, awesome tutorial ! I've got a question. Can i make a css transition effects using .animate() ? I'm trying to make a transition from one color to another when i click on a button

topLevelComment.author: KAWAII OBAMA
topLevelComment.text: Is that your real typing speed? Jesus!?

replies.author: Eshan Parihar
replies.text: They just sped up the video while editing it!!!

replies.author: Robert Halperin
replies.text: Likely using keyboard shortcuts, but still super fast.

topLevelComment.author: Brandon Irizarry
topLevelComment.text: Good stuff! Concise, eloquent.  Also, couldn't help but notice the wizardly text editing. :)
